job_details.Functieomschrijving:
+ Gross monthly salary between EUR 4,331 and EUR 6,186 (scale 09) for a 36 hour week
          + Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
          + 10% Employee Benefit Budget
          + EUR 1,400 development budget per year
          + Hybrid working: balance between home and office work (possible for most roles)
          + A pension, for which you can set the maximum amount of your personal contribution
       Business Analyst - Test Automation Engineer
       Are you passionate about improving cross-border payments and processes? Do you have experience in functional testing and test automation? Then we are looking for you!
       Tribe Account & Payment Factory
       The Tribe Account & Payment Factory is responsible for Payment and Current Account processing and related services. In the Area of Transaction Processing, we deliver fast, reliable, and efficient transaction processing 24/7. To ensure that our services are always available, we are also renewing the payment factory, simplifying our payment landscape, decommissioning legacy systems, and migrating to the new tech stack. High service availability is key, and for a short impression of our Tribe, have a look at this video .
       Your Role
       Within the Area Transaction Processing, the Cross-Border Payments squad is looking for a Business Analyst with a focus on test and test automation. You will strive to continuously improve cross-border payments and processes, ensuring the continuity of this critical payment chain. The Cross-Border team works closely with a team of specialists from our vendor, as it is a vendor-bought application (a rule-based payment engine) on-premises., As the Test Expert within our squad, you will ensure that the Test Strategy aligns with the goals of the bank and the team. You will be actively involved in functionally testing the application and aligning/executing tests with other parties in the critical product chain. Additionally, you will work on setting up and maintaining a testing framework.
          + Functional Testing: Perform functional testing activities and maintain test tooling, testing environments, and test sets.
          + Application Monitoring: Continuity of a critical application in the payment landscape. Monitor the application and analyze & solve production issues (e.g., ad hoc requests from colleagues, business, and other applications in the chain, analyzing logging, making queries, etc.).
          + Product Backlog: Create Product Backlog Items and deliver input for the Product Owner and Tech Lead.
          + Change Processes: Provide operational requirements, safeguard operability, maintainability, robustness, and performance.
       Your Talents
job_details.full_text:
Business Analyst - Test Automation Engineer

+ Gross monthly salary between EUR 4,331 and EUR 6,186 (scale 09) for a 36 hour week
          + Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
          + 10% Employee Benefit Budget
          + EUR 1,400 development budget per year
          + Hybrid working: balance between home and office work (possible for most roles)
          + A pension, for which you can set the maximum amount of your personal contribution
       Business Analyst - Test Automation Engineer
       Are you passionate about improving cross-border payments and processes? Do you have experience in functional testing and test automation? Then we are looking for you!
       Tribe Account & Payment Factory
       The Tribe Account & Payment Factory is responsible for Payment and Current Account processing and related services. In the Area of Transaction Processing, we deliver fast, reliable, and efficient transaction processing 24/7. To ensure that our services are always available, we are also renewing the payment factory, simplifying our payment landscape, decommissioning legacy systems, and migrating to the new tech stack. High service availability is key, and for a short impression of our Tribe, have a look at this video .
       Your Role
       Within the Area Transaction Processing, the Cross-Border Payments squad is looking for a Business Analyst with a focus on test and test automation. You will strive to continuously improve cross-border payments and processes, ensuring the continuity of this critical payment chain. The Cross-Border team works closely with a team of specialists from our vendor, as it is a vendor-bought application (a rule-based payment engine) on-premises., As the Test Expert within our squad, you will ensure that the Test Strategy aligns with the goals of the bank and the team. You will be actively involved in functionally testing the application and aligning/executing tests with other parties in the critical product chain. Additionally, you will work on setting up and maintaining a testing framework.
          + Functional Testing: Perform functional testing activities and maintain test tooling, testing environments, and test sets.
          + Application Monitoring: Continuity of a critical application in the payment landscape. Monitor the application and analyze & solve production issues (e.g., ad hoc requests from colleagues, business, and other applications in the chain, analyzing logging, making queries, etc.).
          + Product Backlog: Create Product Backlog Items and deliver input for the Product Owner and Tech Lead.
          + Change Processes: Provide operational requirements, safeguard operability, maintainability, robustness, and performance.
       Your Talents

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses on business analysis and test automation for payment processing systems. While it mentions improving processes and ensuring application continuity, it does not involve the core responsibilities or technologies associated with ML Engineering or GenAI Engineering, such as algorithm development, predictive modeling, fine-tuning LLMs, or building generative AI applications. The role is primarily centered around functional testing, test automation, and operational support of existing systems, which falls outside the scope of the defined AI engineering profiles.

job_tasks.justification: The role requires understanding cross-border payments and processes, aligning test strategies with bank goals, and creating Product Backlog Items, indicating a need to understand business context and translate it into technical requirements.
The role involves understanding the business needs for the payment factory and its services.
job_tasks.phrase: Payment and Current Account processing and related services

job_tasks.justification: The role requires understanding the business context of transaction processing and its importance for the bank.
job_tasks.phrase: delivering fast, reliable, and efficient transaction processing 24/7

job_tasks.justification: The role requires understanding the business goals of the bank and how testing contributes to them.
job_tasks.phrase: aligns with the goals of the bank

job_tasks.justification: The role involves understanding the operational requirements from a business perspective.
The role involves setting up and maintaining a testing framework, which includes aspects of software development for testing purposes.
job_tasks.phrase: setting up and maintaining a testing framework

job_tasks.justification: The role involves maintaining test tooling, which can be considered a form of software development or configuration.
The role involves ensuring the continuity of a critical application, monitoring it, and analyzing/solving production issues, which aligns with operational support and maintenance.
job_tasks.phrase: Continuity of a critical application in the payment landscape. Monitor the application and analyze & solve production issues

job_tasks.justification: The role involves analyzing logs and making queries to troubleshoot production issues, which is part of operational monitoring and analysis.
The role requires safeguarding operability and maintainability of the application in production.
job_tasks.phrase: safeguard operability, maintainability, robustness, and performance

soft_skills.phrase: aligning/executing tests with other parties in the critical product chain
ad hoc requests from colleagues, business, and other applications in the chain
strive to continuously improve cross-border payments and processes
